newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish bond prices off highs despite U.S. rise.
newsitem.headline: Danish bond prices off highs despite U.S. rise.

text.p: Danish bond prices closed up on Wednesday's levels but off early Thursday highs, despite U.S. indicators coming in as expected and helping treasuries up.
"They've consolidated at a lower level, even though the U.S. numbers were o.k. It's as if everybody's waiting for more data or conclusions on EMU," a dealer said.
The Danish benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 ended at 112.48, yielding 6.08 percent, up 0.23 point from Wednesday.
The seven percent 2007 paper, the benchmark from September 1, was up 0.28 point to 105.38, yielding 6.27 percent. Its yield spread to the German bund widened three basis points to 60 bp.
Dealers expected the yield gap to remain about the same on Friday. Turnover in the 2006 bond was 1.3 billion crowns and in the 2007 paper 870 million.
The six percent mortgage bond due in 2026 fell 0.43 point to 91.12.
The crown was unchanged at 3.8093. --Steve Weizman, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33-969650
